thread.title: nubia M2 with dual rear cameras unveiled, M2 Lite and N2 also announced
thread.title_full: nubia M2 with dual rear cameras unveiled, M2 Lite and N2 also announced

title: nubia M2 with dual rear cameras unveiled, M2 Lite and N2 also announced
text:
nubia M2 with dual rear cameras unveiled, M2 Lite and N2 also... nubia M2 with dual rear cameras unveiled, M2 Lite and N2 also announced By March 21, 2017 “The nubia M2 is the brand’s first phone with dual cameras” 
ZTE’s sub-brand nubia has finally joined the club of dual camera-toting smartphone manufacturers. The company has launched its first smartphone carrying this tech called the nubia M2 in China. Alongside the nubia M2, the brand has also released two more smartphones called the nubia M2 Lite and N2. 
The nubia M2 gets dual 13-megapixel f/2.0 cameras at the back with phase detection autofocus and a dual-LED flash. For selfies and video calling, the device gets a 16-megapixel front-facing shooter. The phone comes with a sandblasted metal unibody design, which is available in two hues – black gold and champagne gold. The device gets a fingerprint sensor, which is integrated into its home button. 
The nubia M2 comes with a 5.5-inch Super AMOLED full HD display, and is backed by a Snapdragon 625 SoC, mated to 4GB of RAM. The phone comes in 64GB and 128GB storage variants, which also accept microSD cards for further memory expansion. The device is fuelled by a 3,630mAh battery, which supports NeoCharge fast charging technology. The other specs include VoLTE, a USB Type-C port, Dolby Surround 7.1 and TruSignal Enhancement technology. The phone’s 64GB variant is being offered for RMB 2,699 (~Rs 25,500), while the 128GB variant will set you back by RMB 2,999 (~Rs 28,400). 
The nubia M2 Lite features a single 16MP f/2.0 ISOCELL camera sensor on the back. The phone comes with a 5.5-inch AMOLED display, a fingerprint sensor, 3GB / 4GB RAM, 32GB / 64GB storage and a 3,000mAh battery. This one is being offered for RMB 1,799 (~Rs 17,000). 
The nubia N2’s highlight is its massive 5,000mAh battery with 18W fast charging support. Despite having a large battery, the device measures only 7.9mm around the waist. Its other features include a 5.5-inch AMOLED full HD display, a 64-bit octa-core SoC of unknown make, 4GB of RAM, 64GB of storage and a 16MP rear snapper with Neovision 6.0. This device will be available from April 8th for RMB 1,999 (~Rs 18,900).
